title: Timers on every blue and red for every side? I'm done jungling

embed.description: This is a W ORK I N P ROGRESS POST. Today's update is HUGE! Going to take a while to get through it all. Thank you for your patience!][ Status: The PBE currently still down for maintenance.] The PBE has been updated! Continue reading for more information!

body:
> When a camp that has a timer (Red, Blue, Dragon, Baron, Rift Herald) has less than 60 seconds to spawn, its timer is revealed to both teams (regardless of their vision of the camp), and an “about to spawn” icon appears in the minimap (will replace regular camp icon if you still haven’t seen the cleared camp)

Since when is this supposed to be a good idea? Pre-mades are making it more difficult with early invades for buffs but now broadcasting the buff timers for everyone to see makes it even easier for pre-mades to put the enemy jungler behind.

Don't get me wrong, I love counter jungling, but it shouldn't be something so obvious and easy for you. Counter jungling can have huge rewards (i.e. all their camps being up, or a buff being up), but risks as well (camps all cleared so waste of time...or running into enemy, or getting cornered). Chances are unless you're in a premade with others on your team, if an enemy premade invades to get your buff, you're not going to have help.  Counter jungling should be about your own skill of warding the enemy jungle and getting the buff times for yourself, not looking at a mini map to see if their buff is up. 

If this change becomes real on summoner's rift, I will not be jungling. Riot is making the game less about skill by putting timers up for everyone to see.

Honestly I'm against the change. Currently guessing the respawn of a buff camp wrong wastes time & puts you at risk of getting killed, in other words it's currently a risk vs reward when counter-jungling.

This change will largely remove much of the risk to counter-jungling & diminish any sense of reward for managing to catch the enemy jungler at their buff & hopefully getting a kill.

I personally would prefer the personal satisfaction that comes from experience & managing to anticipate where the enemy jungler is, rather then "Oh, champ X relies heavy on blue buff & the map says it's about to respawn."

They ARE changing the strength of blue and red. 

A) Mages no longer have mana regen items. Blue is the only way a mage can get through a fight and still be safe to push or contest an objective. Otherwise, the mage is backing late game when the enemy assassin is still good to go.

B) Turrets now have 700 less health and each attack procs an extra blast of red buff. That much free true damage means you'll cut through towers no problem even as a support in the late game.

C) Red buff gives approximately a Warmog's worth of out of combat health regen late game. That's amazing for a split pusher who needs to get in the thick of things and then take towers, like Trundle or Shen.

D) Blue is having its mana regeneration doubled, and its mana regeneration scales based on max mana, which mages are going to have a lot more of.

The same argument was made when buff timers were first introduced. NOTHING about doing simple math takes skill. A decent jungler will track buff timers, it's trivial. I do agree, however, that this just makes the 4+1 experience worse.

Buff timers were only for neutral objectives, enemy needed to ward correctly to get your red/blue timers. Now they get to know when your buffs are up without any actual skill or effort. I'm happy I quit jg a while ago.

Has nothing to do with math. If the jungler's been doing a decent job of clearing your wards at his buffs, you won't know when they're up. Simple as that. You have to know when he cleared them for that math to matter.

Now it's just automatically "We know exactly when it'll be up, without having to try to use any skill in knowing when he did them" which makes jungling anything that's not a counter jungler a nightmare. Because you'll just be pushed out of your own jungle constantly, since counter junglers will know exactly where to be, exactly when. 100% of the time.


In fact, there already wasn't any math in the first place. If you SAW the enemy jungler clear it, you'd have the timer. If you didn't see them clear it, you wouldn't have the timer. And doing math wouldn't help, since you didn't know when they cleared it.
